• Academic Commons
  • Withdrawal Policy

Withdrawing Items

Files will occasionally need to be removed from the Academic Commons at the request of the author or at the discretion of the University. Reasons for removal include revisions by the author, factual inaccuracy, copyright infringement, cost of storage or changes in collection policies.

Because the item may have been cited at at some point, a "tombstone" record will be supplied in place of the withdrawn record. The tombstone record will include the original metadata (for verification) and a withdrawal statement. The item metadata should be visible to anyone following the citation link, but not searchable. Tombstone records will be not be available to Internet search engines.

For historical and administrative reasons, the original metadata record will remain in the Academic Commons system hidden from view. A notice of removal will be added to the hidden record.

If you have questions regarding this policy contact the Academic Commons Coordinator.
